content.description:
Aeneas discovers Helen hiding.

1 Iamque adeo super unus eram, cum limina Vestae

servantem et tacitam secreta in sede latentem

TyndaridaAcc. sing. of Tyndaris, -idis, f.: daughter of Tyndareus aspicio; dant claram incendia lucem

erranti passimque oculos per cuncta ferenti.

5 Illa sibi infestos eversa ob PergamaPergama, -orum, n. pl.: the towers of Troy Teucros

et Danaum poenam et deserti coniugis iras

praemetuens, Troiae et patriae communis Erinys,

abdiderat sese atque aris invisa sedebat.

Exarsere ignes animo; subit ira cadentem

10 ulcisciulciscor, ulcisci: avenge, get revenge for patriam et sceleratas sumere poenas.
content.question: In ancient Rome, who was entrusted with the responsibility of watching over (servantem, line 2) the temple of Vesta?
